CatDescriptText: Miss Ella Garner, student, Black Ridge, Mrs. Joyce Stuckeman, student, Churchill, Miss Linda Fleming, student, and Holly Maxwell, student, Black Ridge, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 14, 1962, pg. 17 with question: "Do you think it is ethical or right for a doctor to go on 'strike' as a protest?"  Ms. Garner's answer reads: "No. My father is a doctor and I know that at times he gets tired from the demands of his patients, but he would never think of going on a strike.  He's above that sort of thing."  Mrs. Stuckeman's answer reads: "No, it isn't fair to his patients."  Ms. Fleming's answer reads: "No.  Their job is supposed to be part of their life.  People would die."  Ms. Maxwell's answer reads: "No.  A lot of responsibility is placed on them.  People's lives are at stake.  It's against the oath they take."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Group portrait of Ella Garner and Joyce Stuckeman, standing in front of truck marked "Transporta ....Line"; Group portrait of Linda Fleming and Holly Maxwell , standing next to truck, buildings in background
